text: Hiya, simple question. When creating a module through “right click -> new module” it generates all files for you with some default content in fields.json and meta.json. Is there anyway to edit this default content i.e. always having my `"content_types"` in meta.json set to `["SITE_PAGE", "LANDING_PAGE"]`

I’m experiencing a massive caching issue right now on a client site, where the Design Manager reflects the changes but the site refuses to display the new changes permanently.

If i use ?hsDebug=true it works for the page that I’m on, but as soon as I navigate away, the changes revert back to the cached version.

I tested in multiple browsers that have not seen the site before and I even tried adding a blank space in the theme HTML footer field to force the site to update but to no avail.

*Edit* And now it started working after 10 minutes…. I’m truly missing an option to flush cache for devs. This is just sad :disappointed:
Agree, I'm in this situation A LOT of times, we desperately need a button on website settings to flush all website cache immediately
